perturbation.original_text: SFDC hereby appoints SUB-RESELLER ("Sub-Reseller") as a sub-reseller to whom Reseller may resell Services in accordance with Section 2(ii) of the Agreement, provided that Sub-Reseller may only resell such Services to Customer.
perturbation.changed_text: SFDC hereby appoints SUB-RESELLER ("Sub-Reseller") as a sub-reseller to whom Reseller may resell Services at its sole discretion, provided that Sub-Reseller may resell such Services to any entity.
perturbation.explanation: This modification alters the 'Sub-Reseller's' obligations, and the scope of sales which contradicts the typical responsibilities and limitations implied in a 'Sub-Reseller Agreement,' which typically has a customer limit.

perturbation.original_text: Reseller must ensure that Sub-Reseller complies with the terms of the Agreement applicable to Reseller as if Sub- Reseller were an original party to the Agreement and any breach by Sub-Reseller of the Agreement will be deemed a breach by Reseller.
perturbation.changed_text: Reseller's responsibility to ensure Sub-Reseller's compliance is purely advisory, and any breach by Sub-Reseller will be addressed separately and not attributed to Reseller.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the direct liability of the Reseller for the actions of the Sub-Reseller, contradicting standard agency principles where a principal (Reseller) is often responsible for the actions of their agent (Sub-Reseller).

perturbation.original_text: The terms and conditions herein contained constitute the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter of this Sub-Reseller Agreement and supersede any previous and contemporaneous agreements and understandings, whether oral or written, between the Parties hereto with respect to the subject matter hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: This Sub-Reseller Agreement is intended as a flexible framework, and the Parties reserve the right to modify terms via subsequent oral agreements, which shall take precedence over this written document.
perturbation.explanation: This statement attempts to negate the 'entire agreement' clause, a standard provision meant to prevent disputes based on prior or side agreements not included in the written contract. This undermines the enforceability of the written contract under contract law.
